name: German Herkules
description: Originally bred in Hull, Germany, Herkules is a descendant of Hallertau and Hull primarily used for bittering.
parentage: Hallertau
flavor: Floral, Spicy

name: Calypso
description: Calypso, with its versatile, evolving character and markedly smooth bittering makes for incredible beer across a range of styles. Fruity notes add crisp flavor to Pale Ales and IPAs, yet an overall complex profile adds depth to Stouts, British Bitters and especially Barleywines.  High in alpha acids and brimming with a flavor-aroma combination all its own, Calypso is a beguiling dual-purpose hop that begs for experimentation.
parentage: NuggetQ
style: American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, British Pale Ale/Bitter, British/American Strong Ale, IPA, Irish and Scottish Ales, Stout/Porter
flavor: Citrus, Floral, Fruity

name: Jarrylo™
description: Despite its upbringing estranged from the IPA cool kids, Jarrylo™ offers complex fruit flavors that make for a very unique Pale Ale and blend seamlessly into an IPA. Indeed, this is how commercial brewers have chosen to use it.
parentage: N/A
style: American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, Hybrid Beers, IPA, Pale Lager
flavor: Fruity, Spicy

name: Waimea
description: Meet Waimea, New Zealand’s jack-of-all-trades. It wasn’t always this way—Waimea was bred for its bittering potential, not exceptional flavor and aroma. Yet this high-alpha hop is full of pleasant surprises, bursting with intense fresh tangelo, citrus fruit and pine needle character.
parentage: Pacific Jade
style: American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, IPA, Pale Lager, Trappist/Belgian Ale
flavor: Citrus, Fruity, Piney

name: Equinox™
description: At first, Equinox is familiar—in a pleasant, desirable way. Tropical fruit, papaya and mango notes reminiscent of Mosaic and Citra offer versatility across fresh-flavored styles. Then, things get weird.  In the midst of the bright citrus and melon there is a ribbon of green pepper. Or something like green pepper. It’s not green pepper in the eat-it-with-hummus-use-it-on-a-fajita sense of green pepper. It’s sweet and fruity but seemingly not fruit.
parentage: N/A
style: American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, British Pale Ale/Bitter, IPA, Irish and Scottish Ales, Pale Lager, Trappist/Belgian Ale, Wheat Beers
flavor: Citrus, Fruity

name: Amarillo®
description: Floral, tropical, and citrus. Excellent flavor/aroma hop for American ales.
parentage: N/A
flavor: N/A

name: Citra®
description: A very new American hop with parentage from Hallertau Mittelfruh, East Kent Goldings, and others. High alpha and strong tropical fruit aromas and flavors (think mango, papaya, and pineapple). Best known as a dry hop in Sierra Nevada Torpedo IPA.
parentage: Hallertau Mittelfrüh, US Tettnang, Brewer's Gold and East Kent Golding
flavor: Strong citrus and tropical tones of grapefruit, melon, lime, gooseberry, passion fruit and lychee

name: Cascade
description: Unmistakable grapefruit aroma and flavor, signature hop of many American ales. Good for dry hopping
parentage: Fuggle, Serebrianka
flavor: Medium intense floral, citrus and grapefruit tones

name: Centennial
description: Very balanced, sometimes billed as a supercharged Cascade, it has a pleasant spicy citrus aroma and clean bitterness.
parentage: Brewer's Gold, Fuggle, East Kent, Golding
flavor: Medium intensity floral and citrus (lemon) tones

name: Simcoe®
description: A high-alpha hop used for both bittering and aroma in American ales. Smooth, clean bitterness, low cohumulone, pine-and-citrus aroma and flavor. Known as a bittering hop with a good aroma
parentage: N/A
flavor: Unique passionfruit, pine, earth and citrus characteristics

name: UK East Kent Goldings
description: Classic English aroma hop. Sweet, spicy floral aroma. Use in all English beers: pale ale, brown ale, porter, stout. A traditional English hop that has been used in kettle and dry hopping
parentage: Canterbury Whitebline
flavor: Smooth and delicate with floral, lavender, spice, honey, earth, lemon and thyme overtones

name: Mosaic™
description: A new dual-purpose hop, bred from Simcoe®, formerly known as HBC 369, this is the latest experimental variety to "go pro" and become a full commercial variety. Bred by the same people who brought you Citra®, Warrior®, Ahtanum™, Palisade®, and Simcoe®. Mosaic™ is so named because it gives a range of aromas and flavors which are complimentary to other common hop aromas. Everything from citrus, pine, earth, herbal, mint, bubblegum, blueberry, lime peel, black pepper - the character seems to change depending upon the conditions it is in. An excellent aroma variety
parentage: Simcoe®
flavor: A complex array of tropical fruit, citrus, berry, herbal, earthy and pine characteristics

name: German Saphir
description: Low-alpha aroma hop with pleasant, bright character with spicy, fruity/citrus notes reminiscent of tangerine. Use for German lagers and Belgian ales. Good aroma variety with a distinct hoppy tang
parentage: N/A
flavor: Distinct spicy, fruit and citrus (tangerine) tones.

name: German Opal
description: German Opal hops are a treasured European hop imparting moderate bitterness and fruity, floral character with notes of spicy citrus. Good aroma type with average to high bitter value
parentage: N/A
flavor: Even dispersal of all aroma characteristics - fruity, floral, herbal and hoppy tones all appear

name: Sorachi Ace
description: Sorachi Ace hops are an excellent addition to Belgian Ales or IPAs. An extremely unique high alpha aroma variety with great bittering characteristics.
parentage: Brewer's Gold, Saazer - OP, Beikei No. 2
flavor: Unique lemon and dill characteristics
type: Saazer - OP and Beikei No. 2 male

name: US Perle
description: US grown version of the German Perle hop, descended from the Northern Brewer variety. Often used as a dual purpose hop in a variety of applications.
parentage: English Northern Brewer
flavor: Slightly spicy with herbal and floral characteristics

name: German Brewer's Gold
description: German Brewer's Gold is a moderate alpha bittering hop with spicy, fruity, and black currant character. Mainly used as a bittering hop.
parentage: Bullion sibling
flavor: Bullion

name: Santiam
description: A seedless aroma hop bred from Tettnanger, Mittelfruh, and an American variety. Spicy, herbal and floral. Use for lagers, wheat beers, and Belgian ales. An American aroma hop with noble hop characteristics.
parentage: Tettnang, Hallertau and a cultivar derived from Cascade
flavor: Slightly spicy with herbal and floral characteristics.

name: Styrian Aurora
description: Also known as Super Syrian, Styrian Aurora hops have a typical alpha of 7.0-9.0%, making them a great addition to US, Belgian, or English ales. Aroma is similar to Styrian Golding, but much lighter with hoppy aroma.
parentage: Diploid cross between Northern Brewer and a TG seedling of unknown origin
flavor: Intense and pleasant displaying floral, pine and hoppy characteristics

name: UK Fuggle
description: Wonderful earthy, pipe-tobacco, floral character. Classic hop for any English beers: pale ale, brown ale, porter, stout.. The most revered and famous English hop, known for its full bodied flavor in traditional ales.
parentage: A chance seedling raised in England
flavor: Delicate and pleasant mint, grass and floral tones

name: US Northern Brewer
description: Northern Brewer hops are used in the brewing of ESB, bitter, English pale ale, porters, and California (steam) beer. A true dual purpose hop variety.
parentage: Cross between a Canterbury Golding female and male OB21
flavor: Medium intensity, pine and mint characteristics

name: Horizon
description: A low co-humulone half-sister to Nugget. Horizon has very smooth bittering characteristics for a high-alpha hop, with a pleasant aroma. Suitable for use in both ale and lager styles.
parentage: Half sister of Nugget; lineage includes Brewer's Gold and Early Green
flavor: Pleasant and spicy, with floral characteristics

name: US Saaz
description: US Saaz hop pellets profile makes them an excellent addition to Pilsners, lagers, wheat beers. Features a classic noble aroma, famously used in Pilsners.
parentage: US equivalent of the longstanding Czech variety
flavor: Mild spice and earth tones

name: US Tettnang
description: US Tettnang hops are mild, with a spicy aroma and low alpha. A true noble aroma variety.
parentage: A traditional German land-race variety
flavor: Noble aroma that is pleasant and spicy

name: Falconer's Flight®
description: Falconer’s Flight® is an exclusive proprietary hop blend created by Hop Union to honor and support the legacy of Northwest brewing legend, Glen Hay Falconer, who passed in 2002. The blend is comprised of many of the Northwest’s most unique hop varieties, including Citra®, Simcoe®, and Sorachi Ace along with experimental hops and numerous other NW varieties. Each hop has been hand selected for its superior aromatic qualities, imparting distinct tropical, citrus, floral, lemon and grapefruit tones. A portion of the proceeds go to support the Falconer Foundation, which supports brewers and brewing.
parentage: A pellet blend containing a variety of the Pacific Northwest's most intriguing aroma hop varieties and additional experimental hops
flavor: Distinct tropical, floral, lemon and grapefruit characteristics

name: German Select
description: German Select hops were released in 2001 adding aroma to your home brewed beers. Bred to be like the Spalt/Tettnang/Saaz group.
parentage: Hallertau mf. and Spalt
flavor: Floral and fruit characteristics

name: New Zealand Pacific Hallertau
description: Southern hemisphere New Zealand Pacific Hallertau Hop Pellets AKA Pacifica hops are a “Fingerprint” replica of Hallertau Mittelfruh with floral and citrus notes.
parentage: N/A
flavor: N/A

name: Australian Galaxy
description: An Australian hop variety that showcases gentle citrus with passion fruit notes, along with a high alpha acid level.  Similar to Citra, but with the tropical fruit toned down and a bit more grassy flavor. Due to the high cohumulone content of this hop, it works best as a late addition or dry hop. Typically used as a late addition - the aroma and flavor characteristics become more pronounced the later the addition.
parentage: Australian high-alpha female and Perle male
flavor: Distinct citrus, peach and passion fruit flavors.

name: New Zealand Nelson Sauvin
description: Nelson Sauvin hops bear the name of their closest aroma descriptor, Sauvignon Blanc grapes - "crushed gooseberry" is the term most commonly used. Alpha acids in the low double digits mean they are a great dual-purpose hop, with low cohumulone, good oil content, and an overall uniqueness that is taking many brewers by surprise. Underlying notes of distinctive New Zealand spiciness: black pepper, mace, and allspice are common.  Commercially, Nelson has been used in everything from pale lagers and pale ales to Belgian ales and Weizenbock. An excellent dual purpose hop that can be used to produce a punch or subtle bittering qualities.
parentage: Cross between New Zealand "Smoothcone" and a selected New Zealand male
flavor: Distinct cool climate and white wine "fruitiness" with fresh crushed gooseberry and grape infused flavors

name: New Zealand Wakatu
description: Imagine an alpha-acidified Hallertau, and you've got New Zealand's Wakatu hops with a typical alpha range of 6.5-8.5%. Characterized by moderate bittering and restrained floral notes atop freshly zested lime. A descendent of Hallertau Mittelfruh, Wakatu is a very versatile southern hemisphere hop lending excellent bittering, flavor, and aroma properties. Complimented for its rounded flavor, moderate co-humulone, outstanding oil profile and rewarding finish.
parentage: Bred from 2/3 Hallertau Mittelfrüh, open pollinated by 1/3 New Zealand derived male
flavor: Restrained floral notes and freshly zested lime

name: Australian Stella
description: With a typical Alpha oc 14-16%, Australian Stella hops Super high oil content, high alpha, and moderate-low cohumulone make this a very promising hop varietal. Aroma is richly piney on a bed of fruity, pleasant floral hoppiness. A note of aniseed squirms underneath. Similar to Simcoe and Chinook.
parentage: N/A
flavor: N/A

name: Australian Topaz
description: Dry hopping produces resinous characteristics while tropical tones are found in higher gravity beers.
parentage: Female tetraploid J78 and male 29-70-54
flavor: Resinous, grassy tones with light tropical flavors

name: Australian Helga
description: Australian Helga Hops bear almost no aroma similarities to it's European cousin - instead, fresh fruit yogurt, crushed super-pungent basil, and darjeeling tea jump out. A low oil and cohumulone, these hops add very unique aroma with moderate bittering. Brewing characteristics closely resemble that of its parent, Hallertau mf.
parentage: Open pollination of a female Hallertau mf
flavor: Very mild and pleasant with delicate floral and herbal tones

name: German Polaris
description: This new German variety was bred at the Hop Research Institute in Hull, Germany, and released in 2012. It is very interesting in that it has an incredibly high Alpha Acid level, at around 20%, and also possesses an incredibly high essential oil content at 4-5 mL/100g. This variety has a bold taste and distinctive flavor with intense floral and fruity aroma with fresh minty notes. A variety with bold taste and differentiating flavor.
parentage: Hull breeding line
flavor: Intense floral and pleasant mint tones

name: German Hull Melon
description: This new German hop variety was bred at the Hop Research Institute in Hull and released in 2012. It has distinct fruit characteristics not necessarily associated with typical hop flavors. It has a pleasant fruity aroma that includes honeydew melon and strawberry. An excellent consideration for varieties not necessarily associated with typical hop flavors.
parentage: Daughter of Cascade
flavor: Distinct fruit characteristics including honeydew melon and strawberry flavors

name: Apollo
description: This US grown super high alpha hop has very strong bittering capabilities and an intense, pungent citrus peel aroma.
parentage: N/A
flavor: N/A

name: New Zealand Green Bullet
description: With a typical Alpha of 11-14% this relatively new hop variety has good, clean bittering properties. Typically used in lagers, but carries the Styrian characteristic of subtle spiciness that is perfect for a stout. Works well when included with finishing varieties such as Fuggle and Willamette.
parentage: Open cross pollination of the New Zealand "Smoothcone" variety
flavor: Subtle spiciness

name: New Zealand Pacific Jade
description: NZ Pacific Jade Hops high alpha and intense aromas of citrus and black pepper add character to your home brewed beers. Delivers soft bitterness with desirable aroma; well suited for "up-front" additions in dryer lager styles.
parentage: Cross of New Zealand First Choice (relative of Late Cluster) and an Old Line Saazer male
flavor: Bold herbal aromas with hints of fresh citrus and crushed black pepper

name: UK Admiral
description: UK Admiral hops are ideal for home brewed English ales. A high alpha hop with balanced bitterness and an acceptable aroma profile; a versatile replacement for both high alpha and dual purpose varieties.
parentage: Cross of Challenger and Northdown
flavor: Pleasant, resinous hop aroma with hints of citrus (orange) and herbal flavors

name: UK Bramling Cross
description: Bramling Cross (UK) Hop Pellets provide the perfect aroma for use in English ales, ESB, bitter, and pale ale. Often used in traditional cask conditioned beers due to its distinct characteristics.
parentage: Cross between Bramling (a traditional Golding variety) and a Manitoban (Canadian) wild hop
flavor: Strong spice, blackcurrant, loganberry and lemon characteristics

name: UK Whitbread Goldings Variety
description: Whitebred Goldings Variety hops provide a hoppy intensity to your homebrewed ales. Similar to Goldings, but not as delicate and containing a more robust, hoppy flavor.
parentage: Open pollination of Bates Brewer
flavor: Fresh earthy, botanical and floral flavors

name: Falconer's Flight® 7Cs Blend
description: A proprietary hop blend from HopUnion that includes 7 of the "c" hops along with a few experimental varieties. A great addition/alternative to any IPA or Pale Ale style beer.
parentage: A pellet blend comprised of seven "C" hops and additional experimental varieties
flavor: Strong fruit and citrus characteristics, with layers of spicy and earthy overtones

name: New Zealand Pacific Gem
description: This New Zealand hop variety has a high has a typically alpha acid level of 13-15%. Unlike other high alpha hops, Pacific Gem does not carry a punchy aroma.
parentage: New Zealand "Smoothcone" and Californian Late Cluster x Fuggle
flavor: No distinct characteristics. Some brewers have noted delicate blackberry and floral or oak tones

name: New Zealand Dr. Rudi (Super Alpha)
description: Super Alpha Hops have a soft aroma that is mainly floral with a bit of citrus, giving impressions of lemongrass and aromatic cedar. Delivers a crisp, bitter edge with fine aroma characteristics; often used to balance regional ales and lagers. Works well in single hopped beers and with multiple aroma varieties.
parentage: Derived from New Zealand Smoothcone
flavor: Fresh citrus peel, pine and lemongrass flavors.

name: New Zealand Motueka
description: These southern hemisphere hop pellets are an excellent variety for single hop bills with multiple applications. An excellent variety for single hop bills with multiple applications.
parentage: Cross between 2/3 New Zealand breeding selection with 1/3 Saazer parentage
flavor: Lively lemon and lime tones with background hints of tropical fruit

name: German Magnum
description: Magnum hops are suitable for a wide variety of beers. A high alpha variety with good yields and disease resistance.
parentage: Daughter of US Galena
flavor: A delicate aroma with inclinations towards floral and fruit flavorings and a prevalent hoppy tang

name: UK Northdown
description: Fruity with some spiciness. An excellent dual purpose hop that works well on its own, or in conjunction with an aroma variety.
parentage: Seedling of Northern Brewer and a downy resistant German male
flavor: Pleasant spice, cedar and pine characteristics with hints of floral and berry flavors

name: Crystal
description: American grown Hallertau hybrid. Used mainly for its aromatic properties. Mild, spicy, floral. Sister hop to Mount Hood and Liberty.  Its mild and pleasant aroma, with spicy and flowery tones add character to your homebrewed beers. The most pungent of the triploid Hallertau hops.
parentage: Triploid variety from German Hallertau mf., Cascade, Brewer's Gold and Early Green
flavor: Mild, spicy and floral

name: Willamette
description: American-grown seedless version of Fuggle. Willamette hop is a ideal for brewing pale ale, ESB, bitter, English-style ale, porter, and stout. A quality aroma hop with low alpha content.
parentage: Triploid seedling of the English Fuggle variety
flavor: Mild and pleasant, with slightly spicy and floral tones

name: Mt. Hood
description: Sister hop to Liberty and Crystal, mildest flavor of the three. Mild, sweet and floral descendant of Hallertau. Aroma for German or US ales and craft lagers. An aroma hop varieties with similarities to the German Hallertau and Hersbrucker varieties.
parentage: Triploid seedling of German Hallertau Mittelfrüh and a half sister to Ultra, Liberty and Crystal
flavor: Mild, herbal and somewhat pungent or spicy

name: UK Progress
description: Moderate strong, good aroma provides great addition to ale, bitter, ESB, and porter home brewed beers. Originally introduced as a replacement for Fuggle, Progress shows excellent potential at both the start and end of the boil.
parentage: Seedling of WGV crossed with O.B.79 (a trial male which was the grandfather of Target)
flavor: Moderately strong spicy, grassy, floral, mint, earth and honey tones

name: Liberty
description: Spicy, sweet, resiny descendant of Hallertau. Aroma for German or US ales and craft lagers. Closely resembles Hallertau mf.
parentage: Cross between the tetraploid female hop cultivar Hallertau Mittelfrüh and a downy mildew resistant male. A half sister to Ultra, Mt. Hood and Crystal
flavor: Mild and spicy with subtle lemon and citrus characteristics

name: German Tradition
description: A close descendant of Hallertau Mittelfruh bred for disease resistance and larger yields. Very refined, sweet aroma. Use for aroma and flavor additions in German lagers.
parentage: N/A
flavor: N/A

name: Nugget
description: Quite heavy and herbal, Nugget pellet hops are great for light lagers. Gaining acceptance as a dual purpose variety.
parentage: Lineage includes Brewer's Gold, Canterbury Golding and Early Green
flavor: Mild and pleasant with spicy, herbal tones

name: Columbus
description: Very pungent aroma, clean bittering properties. Great in American pale ale and IPA. Excellent for dry hopping.
parentage: A descendant of Nugget
flavor: Pungent, black pepper, licorice characteristics with subtle citrus overtones

name: Czech Saaz
description: Delicate floral aroma. Required for Bohemian Pilsners, appropriate for other lager styles and Belgian ales. Signature aroma hop of Pilsner Urquell. The classic "noble" aroma hop with long and strong traditions, associated with the renowned pilsner lager.
parentage: A Czech landrace variety
flavor: Very mild, with pleasant earthy, herbal and floral overtones

name: UK First Gold
description: Versatile variety with spicy, Goldings-like aroma. Kettle and dry hopping for all English styles. A versatile variety perfect for modern beer styles.
parentage: Cross pollination of the Whitbread Golding variety and a dwarf male
flavor: Slightly spicy, but smooth, with tangerine, orange marmalade, magnolia and floral flavors

name: US Fuggle
description: US-grown version of the classic English aroma hop. Use in all English beers: pale ale, brown ale, porter, stout. Mild, woodsy and herbal. A traditional English-type variety.
parentage: A chance seedling
flavor: Mild wood and fruit characteristics

name: UK Challenger
description: Dual purpose hop with moderate bittering and spicy aroma. Suitable for any English ale. A versatile hop, widely used for both early and late kettle additions.
parentage: Granddaughter of Northern Brewer, lineage also includes Northdown and Target
flavor: Cedar, green tea and sweet floral characteristics (as a late addition, it can provide crisp, fruity flavors)

name: Styrian Savinjski Golding (Styrian Goldings)
description: Spicy aroma with sweet/earthy edge. Kettle and dry hop additions for UK and Belgian ales. A world-renowned aroma hop with widespread usage in both ale and lager brewing.
parentage: Conal selection of Fuggle, from Yugoslavia
flavor: Very mild, noble hop flavor

name: Cluster
description: A versatile dual-purpose hop with medium alpha levels and clean bittering. Spicy/floral aroma. The classic hop for Classic American Pilsners. Excellent general purpose variety with balanced bittering and aroma potential.
parentage: Unknown- suggested hybridization of imported varieties and indigenous male hops
flavor: Strong floral and spicy characteristics

name: German Hallertau Mittelfrüh
description: The classic German aroma hop associated with Bavarian-style lager beers and distinguished by an intense, pleasantly harmonic bitterness
parentage: Traditional Hallertau variety
flavor: Mild, yet spicy, with floral and citrus tones

name: German Spalt
description: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy. it is ideal for German ales and lagers. Traditional noble aroma hop with average bitter value and pleasant aroma.
parentage: Traditional German land-race variety selected and grown in the area of the same name
flavor: Mild and herbal, with spicy, floral and fruit tones

name: German Tettnang
description: German noble hop, appropriate for any lager and German ales and wheat beers. Distinctive spicy, fruity aroma and flavor. Traditional noble aroma hop.
parentage: Traditional German landrace variety
flavor: Mild and pleasant with balanced earthy, herbal and floral aroma impressions

name: Chinook
description: Classic bittering hop for American pale ales, stouts, and porters. Sometimes used as a late addition for its intense, spicy and resiny aroma. A high alpha hop with acceptable aroma.
parentage: Cross between Petham Golding and a high alpha USDA male
flavor: Distinct, medium intensity spice and pine characteristics with subtle notes of grapefruit

name: US Magnum
description: Magnum pellet hops are known for bittering value and quality in beer brewing, particularly in the creation of lagers, pilsners and stouts. Generally accepted as a clean bittering hop for ales and lagers.
parentage: A cross between Galena and a German male
flavor: No distinct aroma characteristics

name: Summit™
description: Super-high alpha dwarf variety grown on low trellis systems in the Yakima valley. It has a low cohumulone content with a with funky, earthy, tangerine character. A great late addition hop.
parentage: Cross pollination of Lexus and an unspecified male; derived from numerous plants including Zeus, Nugget and male USDA varieties
flavor: Distinct spice, earthy, onion, garlic and citrus (pink grapefruit, orange and tangerine) tones

name: Glacier
description: Use Glacier pellet hops in your home brewed US and English ales. Excellent dual purpose variety with well balanced bittering properties and a pleasant aroma profile.
parentage: Offspring of Elsasser
flavor: Pleasant hop aroma

name: Palisade®
description: An aroma variety with Tettnang parentage, bred in the Yakima Valley. Very pronounced and pleasant fruity, non-citrusy, aroma with earthy undertones. Use for aroma and moderate bittering additions in American or English ale styles. Used for its aromatic properties and moderate bittering qualities.
parentage: Tettnang parentage
flavor: Apricot, grass and clean floral charcteristics

name: Sterling
description: Sterling pellet hops are the perfect choice for your home brewed lagers and Belgian ales. Finding favor as a Saaz replacement.
parentage: Lineage includes Saaz, Cascade, Brewer's Gold, Early Green and German open pollination
flavor: Herbal and spicy, with a hint of floral, citrus (lemon/pineapple) characteristics

name: Warrior®
description: Super-high alpha hop with low cohumulone. Aggressive bittering hop, a with a mild citrus-and-spice character. Used for its mild, clean bittering properties.
parentage: A proprietary variety
flavor: Mild and resinous with subtle citrus, pine and herbal characteristics

name: Vanguard
description: Vanguard hops have an aroma similar to continental European types. Substitute options are Saaz and Hallertauer Mittelfrüh. Similar aroma to Hallertau mf.
parentage: Cross between USDA accessions 21285 (a Hallertau mf daughter) and 64037M
flavor: Herbal and floral tones

name: Ahtanum™
description: Ahtanum Hop Pellets are a floral, citrus, sharp, and piney addition to your homebrews. Used for its aromatic properties and moderate bittering qualities.
parentage: Open pollination. Developed by Select Botanicals
flavor: Floral, earthy, citrus and grapefruit tones

name: US Brewer's Gold
description: Resiny and spicy bittering hop for use in a variety of beers from English ales to German styles and farmhouse ales. Mainly used as a bittering hop.
parentage: An English variety and sibling of Bullion
flavor: Spicy, fruity characteristics, black currant

name: Millennium
description: A new high-alpha descendant of Nugget with very similar bittering properties. Primarily used for bittering additions, Millennium has a pleasant herbal aroma. Closely resembles Columbus and Nugget.
parentage: Descendant of Nugget
flavor: Mild and resinous with floral and herbal tones

name: French Strisselspalt
description: These authentic French Strisselspalt pellet hops are just the thing for making Saison or Biere de Garde. Globally accepted as a good aroma hop with similar characteristics to Hersbrucker.
parentage: Traditional landrace variety
flavor: Very fine spicy, herbal, floral, lemon and other fruit tones

name: US Goldings
description: The American-grown version of this classic English aroma hop. Mild and floral aroma. Use in all English beers: pale ale, brown ale, porter, stout. Popular among ale breweries in the United States.
parentage: East Kent Golding
flavor: Mild and delicate with sweet floral characteristics

name: Galena
description: Galena is fruity, slightly citrusy and spicy; the perfect ingredient for home brewed ale, porter, stout, ESB, and bitter beers. Excellent high alpha variety with balanced bittering and aroma characteristics; mainly used for bittering, but finding favor as a dual purpose variety.
parentage: Open pollination of Brewer's Gold
flavor: Spicy, blackcurrant and citrus (grapefruit) tones

name: German Northern Brewer
description: Very versatile high-alpha dual-use hop from Germany with clean bittering and good aroma – woody and earthy. Widely used for kettle additions in European, English, and American ales and lagers. A true dual purpose hop.
parentage: A cross between an American wild hop and an English male
flavor: Medium intense herbal and floral tones

name: German Perle
description: German Perle hops' moderate bittering power and under appreciated flowery aroma are the perfect addition to a variety of home brewed beers. A highly acceptable aroma variety with balanced bittering characteristics.
parentage: Bred from English Northern Brewer
flavor: Delicate floral, fruit, spice and mint tones

name: Australian Pride of Ringwood
description: This Australian hop is used mainly for bittering, but aroma is profoundly resinous, fruity, and pleasant. Widely used in Australian ales and lagers. Required for Australian Sparkling Ale. Australia's hop growing industry has made substantial efforts to improve the quality of their hops - whereas this varietal used to regularly express cohumulone values above 40%, it's now closer to Cascade, around 32%. Predominantly used for early kettle additions.
parentage: Open pollination of female 12-50-5 (an open pollination of Pride of Kent)
flavor: Pronounced and pleasant, a distinct Australian aroma with cedar, oak and herbal tones

name: El Dorado
description: El Dorado is an exceptional new dual purpose hop with both high Alpha Acid and intense flavors and aromas. As a bittering hop El Dorado lends a firm but balanced bitterness. This hop has bright tropical fruit flavors and aromas of pear, watermelon, and stone fruit. 14-16% Alpha Acid.
parentage: N/A
flavor: N/A

name: UK Target
description: Nominally a bittering hop, but its herbal, haylike aroma makes it a great late kettle addition. An excellent bittering hop that tends to be too harsh for aroma purposes late in the boil.
parentage: Second generation selection from Northern Brewer and a male Eastwell Golding seedling
flavor: An intense English hop aroma with distinct spicy, floral, sage and citrus characteristics

name: German Hersbrucker
description: Hersbrucker hop pellets are mild to semi-strong with a pleasant and hoppy character ideal for home brewed lagers, pilsners, bocks, and wheat homebrew recipes. Should you need to substitute, we would like to recommend Mt. Hood and French Strisslespalt hops. A delicate aroma hop used mainly in lager type beers.
parentage: Traditional land-race variety selected in the Hersbruck area
flavor: Mild, herbal and floral characteristics, with fruity overtones

name: Newport
description: Super-high alpha hop pellets with an earthy aroma for your home brewed beers. Viewed as an excllent bittering hop.
parentage: Descendant of Magnum and a USDA male 58111
flavor: Mild
